page.title: 17LOCAL HISTORY TILSTON
page.content: Recently the{Roman Road}that goes through the village was rediscovered. This Roman Road goes to the Roman City of Deva (Chester). In the fields outside the village the road was discovered about 30cm. below the surface. Whilst digging,{2 roads}were found alongside each other, a quickly built road and a more permanent road. In the road was found a{wooden plough, now at{Manchester University. Alongside the road has been discovered {the remains of a building.}The dig is still taking place. The stone{stocks are to be found by the village green. They were used in days gone by for punishing people who had done wrong. Around our area are many{wells} from which people in the past collected water. Our school dates back to 1872.
